title: Uninstalling by hash does not work [For Me(tm)]
body:
My understanding of #360 and #369 is that I should be able to uninstall a package using its hash.

It does not seem to work for me using develop as of a few moments ago:

```
[throgg@spack-central spack]$ spack uninstall r-rcpp/uyk74pf
==> Error: r-rcpp matches multiple packages:

-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@5.4.0 -----------------------------
h4lnm7e r-rcpp@0.12.6%gcc

uyk74pf r-rcpp@0.12.6%gcc


==> Error: You can either:
    a) Use a more specific spec, or
    b) use spack uninstall -a to uninstall ALL matching specs.

[throgg@spack-central spack]$ spack uninstall r-rcpp/uyk74pfyiunrhwlpuy756vqz6megyxeq
==> Error: r-rcpp matches multiple packages:

-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@5.4.0 -----------------------------
h4lnm7e r-rcpp@0.12.6%gcc

uyk74pf r-rcpp@0.12.6%gcc


==> Error: You can either:
    a) Use a more specific spec, or
    b) use spack uninstall -a to uninstall ALL matching specs.

[throgg@spack-central spack]$
```
